column1: Charata is a city in the province of Chaco
column2: Argentina. It has 26497 inhabitants as per the 2010 census [INDEC]
column3: and is the head town of the Chacabuco Department and the most important city in the southwest of Chaco
column4: located 280 km from the provincial capital Resistencia.

column1: The city was founded by provincial decree on 4 October 1914.
Charata is the important settlement closest to the Campo del Cielo crater meteoric dispersion (originated by the impact of a large metallic meteoroid
